subject: Investing
title: Inflation-Protected Bonds (TIPS)
description: A quick, practical guide to Inflation-Protected Bonds (TIPS).

hook.text: Inflation erodes bond returns. TIPS are the government's answer: bonds that automatically adjust for rising prices.

buildup.text: TIPS stands for Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities. Their principal rises with the Consumer Price Index.

discovery.text: If inflation is 5%, a $1,000 TIPS becomes $1,050. Interest payments grow too since they're based on the new principal.

twist.text: TIPS underperform regular Treasuries when inflation stays low. You pay for insurance you might not need.

climax.text: In 2022 when inflation hit 9%, TIPS holders were protected while regular bond holders suffered deep losses.

punchline.text: TIPS insure your bonds against inflation. Insurance has a cost.

quiz.question: How do TIPS protect against inflation?
options: Their principal adjusts upward with the CPI
They pay a fixed 10% interest rate
